title: Granit Xhaka changes Instagram profile picture to replace Arsenal photo amid 'f*** off' scandal
text:
Granit Xhaka may have yet to offer an apology to Arsenal supporters after aiming expletives at them - but the midfielder has raised a few eyebrows with a small social media change.

The 27-year-old told fans to 'f*** off' as he was jeered while being substituted during Sunday's 2-2 Premier League draw with Crystal Palace.

An apology was largely anticipated but has so far yet to materialise, with Arsenal head coach Unai Emery admitting he had recommended to Xhaka that he say sorry as talk over whether he should keep the captaincy rumbles on.

Granit Xhaka and Lucas Torriera of Arsenal during a training session at London Colney today

The midfielder has raised a few eyebrows with this small social media change on Instagram

But, while he has been silent since the incident, Xhaka changed his Instagram profile picture from one in which he is sporting the Arsenal armband for one of him captaining Switzerland.

He will be taken out of the firing line as he will not travel to Anfield for Wednesday's Carabao Cup fourth round clash with Liverpool.

Emery will rotate his side for the tie with Calum Chambers, David Luiz and Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang also staying at home.

Xhaka was jeered off the pitch as Arsenal searched for a winner against Crystal Palace

The change in his online profile comes as his boss said the player 'is devastated and sad about the situation.'

Gunners boss Unai Emery has confirmed he held talks with Xhaka at the training ground on Tuesday morning following Sunday's controversial scenes.

The Arsenal manager is refusing to confirm whether Xhaka will continue to wear the armband but has revealed the midfielder is low.

The Arsenal skipper then cupped his hand to his ear as he was hauled off in the second half

'It's not easy for him and for the team. He is now devastated. Devastated and sad. We spoke yesterday and on Sunday night I also spoke.

'This morning, he trained as normal with the group but he is devastated and he is sad about the situation. His commitment with the club is a great commitment every time. He wants to help.

'His behaviour was perfect in training, with the group and with the club. He knows he was wrong. He was wrong and he feels it inside very deeply. But that is normal as a human.

Xhaka took his shirt off in frustration as left the pitch during the Premier League clash

'You need – and every player needs - the supporters' support. Support them, support the team. We spoke and I spoke a lot with him also about that.

'We need to learn and when we are having good matches and good moments, they applaud us and we are happy. But when we are in one difficult moment or we are receiving some criticism, we need to also be strong and to know and to learn to play under that pressure.'

The Arsenal boss refused to confirm if Xhaka had been fined after the incident, saying: 'I think we can again speak about the same, we are in the first step after his mistake. Now is for him to recover as a person.'
description: Xhaka told fans to 'f*** off' as he was jeered while being substituted during Sunday's 2-2 Premier League draw with Crystal Palace and has since made the Instagram change.
